column5: Summer must be here now.Got my floor in my boat and yesterday I got to put it in the lake.Stopped in at Clarks Norther Lights and picked up a few minnows. Was like a rookie at the launch.Backed it in perfectly.took off transom saver and mist important put plug in.Mines on rollers so I tie a rope to front post undo strap and chain then let rope go and it takes of like a rocket.Mhhh didn't take off.Forgot to take back tie downs off.Glad there was no one around to see that.lol.But pulled forward and took them off.Very calm and bluebird sky.Just a beautifull day.Trout was the main target and although I got some they were rather slow.Tried trolling UT nothing doing that so back to jigging for them which produced in around 50 ft.Hit a few mid lake humps with rock pikes in around 8 ft and had a blast catching pretty spawn smallies Every cast had 4-6 fish chasing my crank bait.Had 2 muskies eat my favorite lures so will have to replace them.Was the only boat on the lake which really doesn't bother me.First voyage was a good one.
Looking Good John, will have to reserve your services for a day next year to try for Lake trout before Sister & I go on a Clark's Fly-In. Is most of Ice Out on the lakes now? Larry S
Looks like the Calm before the Storm up there before the invasion.
Strong coffee can really mess up launching a boat!
Messed up my new vinyl already.lol.will be easy to clean now rather than carpet.
Yup.Got that right.This lake is normally very quite Rich.My sanctuary.
Kinda surprised the small mouth were that active chasing lures in that cool of water. What was the water temp? Bill
It seems to be a normal thing Bill.Water temp was 60f.Spawned out female walleyes were there also.Nothing under 23".Will see what happens on Saturday I might plan to be there.
yes it can, 2 weeks ago after 7 miles of bumpy gravel road, boat in the water ready to go and forgot to put gas in the boat
